abstract.p: Architect Lynn M Perkins letter on Herbert Muschamp's July 23 article holds 'blob' buildings are inefficiant, expensive and complicated to build (S)

block.p: Luckily, the earth is still prey to the forces of gravity, building materials still come in straight-edged profiles, construction permit departments are still finicky and conservative, and human beings -- not robots -- are still doing construction [''Architecture's Claim on the Future: The Blob'' by Herbert Muschamp, July 23]. Blobs are inefficient, expensive and complicated to build (except in outer space where spheres may rule). What this means for the foreseeable future is that it will be difficult for blob design to make it out of the realm of high architecture into ordinary mainstream tacky building practices.
